message: victims are commonly spotted in places like airports, bus stations, hotels, truck stops and massage parlors. Red flags include their appearance and demeanor — victims of sex trafficking frequently avoid eye contact, appear anxious or scared and may have cuts, bruises or other signs of physical abuse.

data.description: January 11 is National Human Trafficking Awareness Day. Here’s what you should know and how to help victims.
data.title: Human Trafficking: 5 Important Things You Should Know - Crixeo
